General description

This software is a part of the SmartWatch project.

This project aims to create an open-source and open-hardware smartwatch with the following functionality:

\t• 1.3" OLED display (bright enough to work in outdoor conditions)
\t• BLE module (HM-10), pin-to-pin compatibility with well-known HC-06
\t• small vibration motor (for any kind of notifications)
\t• STM32F103CBT6 microcontroller.
\t• Big external SPI flash memory (M25P40), SW OTA update and a lot of images can be stored there.
\t• BMC150 accelerometer/compass (can recognize double tap on the screen).
\t• BMP180 barometer/thermometer (just because there is a plenty of space).
\t• 320mAh battery allowing up to 3 weeks standby time (with BLE active).

All source code and other documents are available on a GitHub repository, so the whole project can be easily reproduced.

Hardware

Both schematic and PCB were created with KiCAD.

Status: Finished. PCB is assembled, all HW features are tested and work as expected. Standby time seems to be about 3 weeks (with BLE active).

Software

Project is created in EmBitz

Status: Can be used on a daily basis with some basic functionality (automatic date/time synchronization, SMS reception). Feel free to submit patches, create or discuss issues.
